subject: Sexual Health
title: The Male Reproductive Path
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Male Reproductive Path usable.

hook.text: Sperm travel an incredible journey from deep inside the testes to the outside world.

buildup.text: From the seminiferous tubules, sperm move to the epididymis where they mature over several weeks.

discovery.text: During ejaculation, sperm travel through the vas deferens, mix with fluids, and exit the urethra.

twist.text: A vasectomy cuts the vas deferens, blocking sperm from reaching semen while leaving hormones intact.

climax.text: The full path is a precisely coordinated relay involving muscles, glands, and chemical signals.

punchline.text: A relay race from creation to destination.

quiz.question: Where do sperm mature after being produced?
